q: a news story about Egyptology in the last 10 years, you have probably seen Zahi Hawass -- the flamboyant, larger-than-life director of Egypt's Supreme Council of Antiquities-- and you know that he is rarely calm. If the museum is safe, Egypt is safe, Zahi Hawass said to an Associated Press reporter following him. Soldiers ring the museum. Even in crisis, Egypt's government-- and the protesters who would bring it down-- know the country depends heavily on

by one with a technical free throw off an illegal defense, but Lynch answered with a short jumper over Shawn Bradley . The basket gave the 76ers a 99-98 lead, their first since midway through the third quarter. I went to the basket strong and shielded him off with my body, said Lynch, who is eight inches shorter than Shawn Bradley . New All-Star Michael Finley answered with a jumper at 28.4 seconds and appeared to be the hero again for Dallas when he snagged a rebound of Allen Iverson 's miss.

"Egypt recognises and appreciates the care and effort undertaken by the government of Germany to preserve and display the painted limestone bust of Queen Nefertiti," Zahi Hawass said in a statement. But he asked that this unique treasure be returned to the possession of its rightful owners, the Egyptian people. FILE- In this March 7, 1982 file photo, Cleopatra's... coming. Google's results have been extraordinary." Eric Schmidt wasn't the man to wage war with Facebook, he said. "There is no making Facebook go away," he said. Now for the first time ever, Google will have to co-exist. They clearly feel that Will Page is the man to accomplish that in the future. During the earnings call last night, Sergey Brin said that the company has only touched "just 1 percent of the capabilities" of real-time search and social search. "If you think about the

"There was an overreaction to Sergio Marchionne 's comments, which shows how fragile the Italian economic system is," said Turin Mayor Sergio Chiamparino , with whom Sergio Marchionne regularly plays cards. I told Sergio Marchionne he should better explain his business model, which represents a revolution for the Italian culture.-- With assistance from Tim Higgins in Detroit and Marco Bertacche in Milan. Editors: Jerrold Colten, Chad Thomas To contact the reporters on this story: Tommaso Ebhardt in Milan at tebhardt@bloomberg.net; Lorenzo Totaro

"Making taxpayers, in effect, foot the bill for banks' lobbying or campaign activities is not justified under any circumstances," Bill Lockyer said. It's improper, it will stop now, it will not happen again and we will get our money back. Last year, for example, SIFMA lobbied against a bill that requires marketing intermediaries, who help investment funds win multibillion-dollar deals with state pension funds, to register as lobbyists with the state.

Many donations came from contributors who were inspired by the speech-- now known as the "Filibernie"-- opposing a plan Congress passed in December that extended tax cuts for the wealthy. Given the fact that I'm about the worst fundraiser in the United States Senate, that helps, Sen. Bernie Sanders said in an interview last month. Calling Sen.
